sources.title: The Snows of Kilimanjaro
sources.description: The story centers on the memories of a writer (Gregory Peck) who is taking a safari in Africa. He develops a dangerous wound from a thorn prick, and lies awaiting his slow death. The loss of physical capability causes him to look inside himself - at his memories of the past years, and how little he has actually accomplished in his writing.

sources.title: The Snows of Kilimanjaro (1952), starring Gregory Peck, Susan Hayward and Ava Gardner
sources.channelName: Public Domain Movies - Classic Old Movies

sources.title: The Snows of Kilimanjaro (1952) Gregory Peck, Ava Gardner | Adventure, Drama
sources.description:
His Adventures . . . Like His Loves . . . Were Great and Exciting !
Writer Harry Street reflects on his life as he lies dying from an infection while on safari in the shadow of Mount Kilamanjaro.

Original title: The Snows of Kilimanjaro (1952)

Directors: Henry KingRoy Ward Baker
Writers: Casey Robinson, Ernest Hemingway (short story)
Stars: Gregory Peck, Susan Hayward, Ava Gardner
Genres: Classics, Adventure, Drama, Romance, War
SFX: Ray Kellogg


00:00 Full Movie with subtitles
01:29 Kilimanjaro is introduced with its snow-covered peaks and the mystery of the leopard's presence at high altitude.
10:15 Harry reflects on his regrets and memories with Helen as vultures circle overhead, symbolizing mortality.
32:50 Harry recounts his adventures in Paris with Cynthia, highlighting his youthful arrogance and passion for writing.
55:40 The safari scenes depict Harry and Helen’s tense interactions, culminating in Harry's infection from a scratch.
1:14:30 A flashback to Harry's passionate but tumultuous relationship with Cynthia, ending in heartbreak.
1:38:20 Harry's final conversation with Helen, where he admits his fears and expresses love, blending vulnerability with acceptance of fate.
1:46:59 The arrival of the rescue plane brings a glimmer of hope amidst Harry's deteriorating condition, closing the story.


@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: As writer Harry Street lays gravely wounded from an African hunting accident he feverishly reflects on what he perceives as his failures at love and writing. Through his delirium he recalls his one true love Cynthia Green who he lost by his obsession for roaming the world in search of stories for his novels. Though she is dead Cynthia continues to haunt Street's thoughts. In spite of one successful novel after another, Street feels he has compromised his talent to ensure the success of his books, making him a failure in his eyes. His neglected wife Helen tends to his wounds, listens to his ranting, endures his talk of lost loves, and tries to restore in him the will to fight his illness until help arrives. Her devotion to him makes him finally realize that he is not a failure. With his realization of a chance for love and happiness with Helen, he regains his will to live.
metadata.Actors: Gregory Peck, Susan Hayward, Ava Gardner
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. 1 win & 3 nominations total
